alert.note: Alert for Boone; Gallatin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 3:43PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF OHIO, CENTRAL DEARBORN, NORTHEASTERN SWITZERLAND, BOONE, EASTERN GALLATIN AND SOUTHWESTERN HAMILTON COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM EDT... At 343 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Dillsboro, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Florence, Lawrenceburg, Greendale, Aurora, Rising Sun, Burlington, Hidden Valley, Oakbrook, Union, Cleves, Dillsboro, Shawnee, Moores Hill, Guilford, Wilmington, Manchester, French, Hartford, North Bend and Patriot. This includes I-71 in Kentucky between mile markers 63 and 64. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern Indiana...northern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
